i ABSTRACT GREEN METHODOLOGY FOR SYNTHESIS OF 4-THIAZOLIDINONES THROUGH MULTICOMPONENT REACTION . Jonas da Silva Santos Orientadores: Profa Flavia Martins da Silva e Prof¬∞ Joel Jones Junior Abstract da Tese de Doutorado submetida ao Programa de P√≥s-gradua√ß√£o em Qu√≠mica, Instituto de Qu√≠mica, da Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro ‚Äì UFRJ, como parte dos requisitos necess√°rios √† obten√ß√£o do t√≠tulo de Doutro em Ci√™ncias (Qu√≠mica).

Thiazolidinones are derived from taizolidines, which are part of an important group of heterocycles of scientific interest due to their chemical properties and the range of biological activity they present. They consist of a five-membered ring, containing sulfur in position 1, nitrogen in position 3 and carbonyl group in position 2, 4, or 5.

The 4-thiazolidinones have several substitution sites, groups of substituents in positions 2, 3 and 5 are identified as the main factors that influence the different biological activities, promoting changes in the physical-chemical and structural parameters in the thiazolidinonic skeleton. Among the various activities they present, the following stand out: bactericide, analgesic, pesticide, fungicide, antiretroviral, insecticide, antiprotozoal, anticonvulsant, tuberculostatic, anti-inflammatory, anti-tumor.

In this work, a synthesis strategy was developed to obtain three series of 4- thiazolidinone derivatives, 15 (fifteen) 1,3-thiazolidin-4-ones 2,3-diphenyl substituted 68a-g (18-70%), 68h-o (11-48%) and 2 (two) spiro-thiazolidinone compounds 81a-b (29-74%), obtained by MALI reaction pathway (Mercaptoacetic Acid Looking Imine), which consists of cycloaddition between an imine and mercaptoacetic acid through a green methodology. The methodology used in this work consists of the use of alternative solvents, such as ethyl lactate (EL) and solvent free reaction conditions (SFRC), for the synthesis of 4- thiazolidinones. The characterization of these potentially bioactive derivatives was carried out using analysis techniques IR, GCMS, GCFID, m.p. and NMRs.
Keywords : 4-thiazolidinones, alternative solvents, Green Chemistry.
Rio de Janeiro Julho de 2021
